item.title: Dispatching MouseEvents to the Canvas
item.dc:creator: @zbubblez zbubblez
item.description:
@zbubblez wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:6, topic:462983”]You never actually create the event to dispatch, you just invoke it when a mouse button is pressed so you are just going to go into an infinite loop.[/quote]I see!!! Can you show me the proper mouseevent?

@zbubblez wrote:

Pwnd:

Where is dispatchEvent ever used? Are the arguments being passed correctly?

if (canv != null && canv.getName().contains("canvas1")) { synchronized(canv) { event.setSource(canv.getMouseListeners()[0]); canv.dispatchEvent(event); } }

item.title: Dispatching MouseEvents to the Canvas
item.dc:creator: @zbubblez zbubblez
item.description:
@zbubblez wrote:

Ollie:

can you show me where you init the event field?

[code]@Override
public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e) {
this.dispatchMouseEvent(e);
}

@Override
public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e) {
	mX = e.getX();
	mY = e.getY();
	this.dispatchMouseEvent(e);
}

@Override
public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent e) {
	// this.dispatchMouseEvent(e);
}

@Override
public void mouseEntered(MouseEvent e) {
	this.dispatchMouseEvent(e);
}

@Override
public void mouseExited(MouseEvent e) {
	this.dispatchMouseEvent(e);
}

@Override
public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e) {
	clickPoint = new Point(e.getX(), e.getY());
	new Thread(PaintMouse).start();
	this.dispatchMouseEvent(e);
}

@Override
public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e) {
	this.dispatchMouseEvent(e);
}

[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Dispatching MouseEvents to the Canvas
item.dc:creator: @zbubblez zbubblez
item.description:
@zbubblez wrote:

For some reason my MouseHandler decides its gonna send 10-12 mouse clicks to the canvas even though I click once, and then I got a stackOverFlow

here my DisptachMethod:

public void dispatchEvent() { if (canv != null && canv.getName().contains("canvas1")) { event.setSource(canv); canv.dispatchEvent(event); } }

the event is taken from the MouseListener

Read full topic
